result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond L Doucette

records.addlTxt: *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:35 PM Defendant Raymond L Doucette appeared by video, in custody from Marquette County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address and phone. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and wants to get an Attorney.  

Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with conditions. 

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on November 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
